title: The Writer's Almanac - Tuesday, February 2, 2021
description: W.B. Yeats once said, “Never have I seen so much pretension with so little to show for it,” about a young Irish writer named James Joyce, born this day, 1882.
itunes:author: Prairie Home Productions
itunes:subtitle: W.B. Yeats once said, “Never have I seen so much pretension with so little to show for it,” about a young Irish writer named James Joyce, born this day, 1882.
